Show that the binary operation * on A= R — { — 1} defined as a*b = a + b + ab for all a, b  A is commutative and associative on A. Also find the identity element of * in A and prove that every element of A is invertible. Solution: Commutative: For any elements a, b  A a * b = a + b + ab = b + a + ba = b * a. Hence * is commutative Associative: For any three elements a, b, c,  A a * (b * c) = a * (b + c + bc) = a + b + c + bc + ab + ac + abc (a * b) * c = (a + b + ab) * c = a + b + ab + c + ac + bc + abc  a * (b * c) = (a * b) * c, Hence * is Associative.
